title: Rory Gallagher - Calling Hard (1992) [ULTRA-RARE 2 CD OFFICIAL B
description:
THIS SHARE COMES COURTESY SGTSTEINER --


Hello All -- the Sgt. here.  Bringing you more of the very obscure and obscenely RARE goodies that are in danger of silently slipping out of cyberspace.

These are the first 2 CDs from the Rory Gallagher Officially Released Bootleg called "The G-Man Bootleg Series Vol. 1".   You can read more about it here -- 
 <a href="
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_G-Man_Bootleg_Series_Vol.1" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_G-Man_Bootleg_Series_Vol.1</a>

I'm on a bit of a Rory kick and when I found out about this release I became a man on a mission.  I searched EVERYWHERE and came up goose eggs time and time again.  Of course, a new copy is only $250 (?!?) on Amazon. 

So after burning through every resource I knew of, I asked GBX to search his old HD's in hopes he'd acquired it somewhere along the way.  What a lucky break!  He found it!  And I promptly went about fixing the track lists, adding proper metadata and artwork, etc.

What you have here is my all-time favorite live Rory Gallagher boot -- which is actually comprised of chunks of three live shows.   Obviously these discs were originally sourced from Vinyl -- you will hear cracks and pops now and again, which didn't bother me in the slightest, simply added to the atmosphere and SCORCHING PERFORMANCES throughout.

CALLING HARD -- Disc One

"Messin With The Kid" - 6:30 
"Cradle Rock" - 12:10
"I Wonder Who" - 9:17 
"Tatoo'd Lady" - 5:29
"Stompin Ground" - 5:25
"Who's That Coming" - 6:18
"Bullfrog Blues" - 8:56 
"Do You Read Me" - 6:29
"Secret Agent" - 6:07
"Calling Card" - 8:14

CALLING HARD -- Disc Two

"Bought And Sold" - 7:05
"Too Much Alcohol" - 4:54 
"Going To My Hometown" - 5:33
"Country Mile" - 6:52
"Bullfrog Blues" - 10:49 
"Shin Kicker" - 3:11
"The Mississippi Sheiks" - 7:23
"Do You Read Me" - 8:31
"Brute Force And Ignorance" - 5:01
"Tattoo'd Lady" - 5:17
"Shadow Play" - 6:29
"Cruise On Out" - 6:02

Well, there you have it.  My good deed for the month for the old-school dinosaur rock types like myself out there.  Enjoy and PLAY LOUD!  MORE RORY TO THE PEOPLE!


PLEASE NOTE -- "Thank you's", "Right On's", etc. always appreciated in the comments.
